alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Hall; Hamilton; Howard; Merrick; Nance; Polk; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 6:22PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT GREELEY...NANCE...NORTHWESTERN YORK...HAMILTON...MERRICK...WESTERN POLK...HOWARD AND EASTERN HALL COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM CDT... At 622 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Spalding to near Cushing to near Phillips. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Palmer, Phillips, Chapman, and Archer around 625 PM CDT. Aurora, Central City, Marquette, and Belgrade around 635 PM CDT. Fullerton around 640 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Hampton, Hordville and Clarks. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 304 and 357. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central and south central Nebraska. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central, central and east central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Greeley; Hall; Hamilton; Howard; Merrick; Nance; Polk; York
